metadata.title: California Title 24 Part 6 Energy Compliance Requirements
metadata.source: California Title 24 Part 6 (Energy Code) + SF DBI Info Sheets M-04, M-06 + AB-112

code_cycle_note: 2022 Title-24 applies to permits filed before Jan 1, 2026. 2025 Title-24 applies to permits filed on/after Jan 1, 2026. Filing near the changeover requires careful code edition selection.

residential.description: Single-family, townhome, duplex. Low-rise (3 stories or less) multifamily uses LMCC/LMCI/LMCV forms starting with 2022 code.

CF1R.purpose: Demonstrates project design and equipment comply with Energy Code

variants.CF1R-ALT-05: Prescriptive alterations NOT requiring HERS verification (simplified)

CF2R.purpose: Documents installed equipment meets CF1R specifications

CF3R.when_submitted: At inspection (field verification by HERS rater)
CF3R.purpose: Third-party field verification and diagnostic testing
CF3R.note: Only required when project triggers HERS measures. Must be registered with HERS Provider Data Registry.

variants.CF3R-MCH-28: Return duct design and air filter sizing

nonresidential.description: Commercial, retail, office, restaurant, hotel/motel, high-rise residential

NRCC.purpose: Demonstrates nonresidential building design meets Energy Code

NRCA.purpose: Verifies systems perform as designed (lighting controls, HVAC, etc.)

residential: HERS if conditioned space added > thresholds

residential.hvac_replacement: CF1R-ALT-05 (prescriptive, no HERS) OR CF1R-ALT-02 (requires HERS if >25ft duct replaced)
residential.water_heater_replacement: CF1R-ALT-05 sufficient for prescriptive approach. Note: changing fuel source has restrictions.
residential.window_replacement: CF1R required. U-factor and SHGC must meet climate zone 3 requirements.
residential.insulation: CF1R required. R-value must meet current code for climate zone 3.
residential.reroof: Cool roof requirements may apply (CF1R-ENV section)

nonresidential.hvac_replacement: NRCC required. Acceptance testing (NRCA) required for systems >54,000 BTU/hr.
nonresidential.lighting_replacement: NRCC for lighting power density. NRCA acceptance test for lighting controls.
nonresidential.envelope_changes: NRCC required for any changes to building envelope (windows, walls, roof).
nonresidential.tenant_improvement: NRCC required if altering lighting or HVAC. Common correction: TI permits filed without energy forms.

common_corrections.description: No energy compliance forms submitted with permit application
common_corrections.frequency: Very high — most common Title-24 correction
common_corrections.fix: Submit CF1R/NRCC with initial application. Many applicants don't realize alterations trigger Title-24.

common_corrections.description: Existing conditions not documented for alterations
common_corrections.frequency: High — #1 correction for alteration projects specifically
common_corrections.fix: CF3R-EXC-20 (Existing Conditions Verification) must be completed for alterations. Cannot prove compliance without baseline.

common_corrections.frequency: Medium — spikes near code changeover dates
common_corrections.fix: 2022 forms for permits filed before Jan 1, 2026. 2025 forms for permits filed on/after Jan 1, 2026.

common_corrections.description: Gas equipment specified in all-electric required project (SF-specific)
common_corrections.fix: New construction in SF must be all-electric. Title-24 docs cannot show gas consumption. Exception requires formal infeasibility review.

common_corrections.description: HERS verification required but not registered with provider
common_corrections.fix: If project triggers HERS measures, CF1R must be registered with HERS Provider Data Registry before permit issuance.

common_corrections.description: Prescriptive approach used when performance approach required
common_corrections.fix: If any element doesn't meet prescriptive minimums, must use performance approach (CF1R-PRF-01) which allows tradeoffs.

all_electric_new_construction.rule: All new construction must be all-electric. No gas infrastructure or piping.
all_electric_new_construction.exception_process: Formal infeasibility review by qualified engineers. Must demonstrate all available energy efficiency features were applied to all-electric option.
all_electric_new_construction.documentation: Title-24 compliance docs must not include gas consumption. AB-093 Attachment E required.

green_building_requirements.rule: Green Building Site Permit Submittal required for new construction permits. Documents compliance with SF Green Building Ordinance.
